data: Towards Christmas time, in the year 1780, as I lay soundly sleeping in my room at the Swan Tavern, in Tübingen, old Gideon Sperver burst suddenly into my room, crying, “Gaston, my boy, I have come to take you back with me to the Castle! You know Nideck, twenty miles from here,—the estate of my master, the Count of Nideck!”
Christmas | Swan Tavern | Tübingen | Castle | Nideck | Count of Nideck

Towards Christmas time, in the year 1780, as I lay soundly sleeping in my room at the Swan Tavern, in Tübingen, old Gideon Sperver burst suddenly into my room, crying, "Gaston, my boy, I have come to take you back with me to the Castle! You know Nideck, twenty miles from here,--the estate of my master, the Count of Nideck!"

The Count of Nideck
adapted from the French of Erckmann-Chartrian
Fiske, Ralph Browning; Erckmann-Chatrian; Searles, Victor A. [Illustrator]
